text:
create me a react native with expo project called Test
I'll help you create a new React Native project with Expo. Follow these steps:

1. First, make sure you have Node.js installed on your computer.

2. Open your terminal and run these commands:

```bash
# Install Expo CLI globally if you haven't already
npm install -g expo-cli

# Create a new project called Test
npx create-expo-app Test

# Navigate into the project directory
cd Test

# Start the development server
npx expo start
```

After running these commands, you'll have a new React Native project with this basic structure:

```
Test/
├── App.js
├── app.json
├── assets/
├── babel.config.js
├── node_modules/
├── package.json
└── package-lock.json
```

The default `App.js` will look something like this:

```javascript
import { StatusBar } from 'expo-status-bar';
import { StyleSheet, Text, View } from 'react-native';

export default function App() {
  return (
    <View style={styles.container}>
      <Text>Open up App.js to start working on your app!</Text>
      <StatusBar style="auto" />
    </View>
  );
}

const styles = StyleSheet.create({
  container: {
    flex: 1,
    backgroundColor: '#fff',
    alignItems: 'center',
    justifyContent: 'center',
  },
});
```

To run your app:

1. Install the Expo Go app on your mobile device
2. Make sure your computer and mobile device are on the same network
3. Run `npx expo start` in your project directory
4. Scan the QR code with your mobile device (iOS: Camera app, Android: Expo Go app)

You can now start developing your React Native app! The app will reload automatically when you save changes to your code.

Would you like me to help you add any specific features or components to your new project?
